The ADAL end of life announcement is in regards to support tickets and patches for security vulnerabilities.  The Azure AD endpoint is "standards-protocol complaint", and there will be no server-side change that will block an ADAL client or any other client using standards-based protocols.  This is more about expectation that there will be no new releases of ADAL even in the case of an security vulnerability.

Also, please note that ADAL end-of-life has been extended to Dec 2022:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/howto-get-list-of-all-active-directory-auth-library-apps
